body: Good find @XD-DENG , will need to look into it and as Ash  mentioned we might want to stop loading all dags

Considering adding log collection and xcom support to the operator and an
executor and probably just making all of it a plugin.. Will put the link
here if and when I am done.

On Thu, Nov 29, 2018, 7:42 AM Nathaniel Mar <notifications@github.com wrote:

> @ramSeraph <https://github.com/ramSeraph> -- Unfortunately, this has also
> been pushed back for me (my team) at the moment, so you're welcome to take
> it up! If not, then I'll hopefully pick it back up around the New Year.
>

Was this fixed?
@kaxil - Would it be possible to get this in for the 1.10.2 release?  1.10.1 is completely broken for us when using the Kubernetes Executor.
@SamWildmo , this pr never get checked in. Do you encounter similar issues? My original concern is that this pr is only applied to localExecutor for backfill.
Ping @ashb. Hopefully this will be quick to review, since most of the diff is indenting for context managers.
@kppullin Definitely. @dlamblin Can you review this one?
ping @kaxil (now it seems that another build is failing,nor sure why)
Is there any further update on when this PR will be actioned on closed ?

> Is there any further update on when this PR will be actioned on closed ?

As far as I know, the PR is approved. Awaiting merge. @Fokko, can you help see to this? Thanks

+1 for the support of tenacity and python 3.7. 3.7 has been released in june, and we are in november. 
Python 3.7 is the default version of fedora 29.

@kaxil Yes, it checked for `is not None` but not for empty string.

When did we release the change that deprecated/removed BQL?

The code change is fine, just wondering about upgrade paths for people with by back-compat hat on 🎩
yes that is true @sokoloff 👍 Thanks

Thanks, @tal181 for your contribution :)

Thanks @XD-DENG @feluelle for help in reviewing
@kaxil Thank you for reviewing! Replied the comments in their own thread.

@ron819 I'm going to address this bug in my PR. 

@ashb I'm still looking for some clarity on what is going on with the json_client. Even looking at the `pool` examples that currently exist there, I'm still not sure what exactly I need to do. Seems like some kind of http handling, but I assumed that was being handled by the `www` and `www_rbac` code. Any guidance you can give would be great.
This file is more like doc for airflow security feature. Should we put this into contribute file?
lgtm
@hesenp are you still working on this?

Hi @ashb , this PR is to add test for the PR https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/4069 in which aoen fixed the issue in `deletion of DAGs in the UI` feature. 

Hi @kaxil , understand that you have already cherry-picked the fix from https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/4069 into 1.10.2. I would suggest to cherry-pick this PR into branch 1-10-test as well so that we can release the fix in https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/4069 with more confidence (lack of test was partially why that fix was not in 1.10.1).

Thanks!

Also happens to me in 1.9.0
Duplicated ticket: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-3364

From what I can tell this bug will follow also to the new UI.

@Fokko - Thanks for the heads up on the CI failures!  I believe the referenced `sla_miss` failures were a red herring, with the actual errors being flake8 issues (my fault) and an existing python2 compatibility issue exposed by the new tests (lack of the `dict.copy` function).  I then broke things more with my first attempt at fixing the python2 issue, since I thought the affected data structure was a list.  CI went green once I switched the logic to handle a dict.

Thanks @tmiller-msft .

What I meant earlier is that the cases where `database/collection already exists` should be handled explicitly within Operator. Otherwise the impression we get from your Operator code is `the Operator is always creating database/collection, no matter if it exists`, which is not correct.

Currently, your logic checking if database/collection already exists is "hidden" in your `hook.create_database`/`hook.create_collection`. What I would suggest is to have separate method in your Hook, say `hook.if_database_exists`/`hook.if_collection_exists`, to check if database/collection exists, then invoke them explicitly in your Operator, like

```python
hook = AzureCosmosDBHook(azure_cosmos_conn_id=self.azure_cosmos_conn_id)

if not hook.if_database_exists(self.database_name):
    hook.create_database(self.database_name)

if not hook.if_collection_exists(self.collection_name):
    hook.create_collection(self.collection_name)
```

(inside your `hook.create_database`/`hook.create_collection`, still good to keep try-except).

**BTW, seems something is wrong with your rebasing**. Please check.
Ah yes, I see what you mean.. I will update to do that instead.. and yeah, fixing rebasing as well, give me an hour or three.
Thanks @tmiller-msft .Kindly take your time :-)

However in any case this PR updates only the old UI (which will be deprecated when https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/4142 is merged) You should update also the rbac UI.

@kaxil, okay. And sorry for this bug :(

@mahrz24 This is very interesting to me. It would simplify my work and also allow for better modularization of applications. Currently, most plugins are kept in this repo, or kept in other repositories and have to be manually copied. In the second case it is annoying, because the repository has worse versioning. Packages were created as the target format for distributing Python code and I hope that Airflow will follow this idea.
